reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel online after seeing the picture of the beautiful house on the website. Although that part of the building is there they have failed to publish photos of the building itself which is reminiscent of a 1970's old people's home.
reviews.title: Very disappointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I asked via email before arriving if anything could be done as it was my girlfriend's birthday - didn't even receive a Happy Birthday, in fact the receptionist almost ignored us as she ran through the 'welcome' procedure. She appeared far too focussed on tidying papers and didn't look us in the eye.The rooms are very old fashioned and the bed not particularly comfortable.
reviews.title: A great value hotel for a visit to Stratford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: I was asked to use a card as a holding deposit, that in itself is fine but I was then charged for the room twice after being assured this wouldn't happen. When I rang to discuss an apolosy wasn't offered.
reviews.title: Conference hotel that misses the basics, not 4*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst at the hotel we asked the receptionist to book a taxi for us. She didn't and we were late for dinner.
reviews.title: Top Notch Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was a poor experience. The surrounding fields are beautiful but I would never stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Really wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel and venue was chosen by a supplier for a recent conference. the best I can say is that it was only 1 night. Upon arrival, the hotel did not have my reservation although I had a confirmation from the travel agent. They gave me the "last room." Hotels like to say it's the last room, so I am always a bit skeptical. After a 15 minute checkin process I arrive in my room, 302. This was a diabled accessible room, which normally isn't an issue but it had 2 twin bed and a shower area vs. a normal shower. The shower would have been fine but the room smelled like a nursing home and it was quite dirty as I assume it doesn't get much use. I called and asked to be moved, after almost 30 minutes I was move to another room, 315, even though I had the "last room." This rooms was smaller, but a standard room except it also had twin beds. Not wanting to spend much time in this awful space I went to the bar to meet some colleagues. The bar was nice enough and the service was good. That would be the end of good service for this hotel. Following our drinks reception we went to the restaurant. Given that we were approx. 80 people and most of us arrived at once, I expected things to be a bit slow, but we began a very weird dinner experience. Firstly, someone came to read us the dinner options from a pre-set menu, although other colleagues were allowed to order from the regular menu. Then the server took our room numbers, although the dinner was covered by the supplier. We then got water and bread, followed by dinner orders being taken from the limited options. We were now about 15 minutes in and no one had taken a drink order. Finally after dinner orders were taken, they took drink orders, however, the bottles of wine we ordered took almost 20 min. to arrive. The food began to arrive and it was definitely not worth the wait. One of the driest pieces of beef I had ever had (no one asked how I wanted it cooked), cold mash, and overcooked veg. The soup was ok. After a rather unimpressive evening, we all retired for the evening. The next morning at the very average breakfast of undercooked sausages, slow coffee service, and cold scambled eggs, we all identified that most of us didn't sleep well as the rooms were stuffy with no aircon and windows that only opened slightly. Curtains that did not block the 4:30am light, and noise all night from some kids staying in the hotel. The other thing that stands out to me is the poor lighting everywhere in the hotel. From the bathrooms in the bedrooms to the restuarant to the common areas it's all very dark. The aircon in common areas also doesn't seem to work well and I spent most of the day sweating. Overall a great conference but not a great venue. As a person who chooses venues frequently for my own business use, it did, at least, give me some things to make sure we never do or allow for our participants.
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked this for a sisters weekend away, Had an executive room and a twin room and the difference in quality was huge. The swimming pool, sauna and jacuzzi were quiet and clean and lovely to use. Staff were very helpful especially at breakfast although sister ordered poached eggs and it took about 15 mins to be brought out! We had a great deal with 3 course meal accommodation and taxi into stratford.
reviews.title: Celebratory weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in June and will not be returning. Overall the hotel is fine but definitely not the 4 stars it claims to be and definitely not stylish. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place with a bit of character, I think a previous reviewer likened the hotel to a glorified travelodge and I think that sums it up nicely. Our room was in the block which was similar to a nursing home and was incredibly dark and dated. The bathroom was tired and we had no minibar in the room (again making me think of a travelodge). My main issue like others is with the reception staff. The hotel's website states that you can use superfast wifi access via a pincode from the hotel. When I asked the hotel receptionist for the code she said that there was none and was incredibly unhelpful. NOT great if you're a business traveller. Checking out took 30 minutes as there was only one receptionist and a huge queue. Why no one thought to have more than one person amazes me? BUT the nail in the coffin that convinced me never to return is being woken up on the day of check out by cleaning staff looking to service my room at 9.55 am on a Sunday. It's a SUNDAY!
reviews.title: Tarted up travelodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from that the staff at the bar were very friendly and great. Leisure facilities helped to some degree to make up for the rest.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last year but standards have slipped badly. Rooms rather tired looking & could do with a facelift now. Food was poor. Breakfast buffet style had been cooked for some time and kept warm. The eggs were disgusting. The evening meal was little better. I ordered the Eton Mess dessert and what a mess it was. Just a plate of cream with a few berries. I complained and although the manager agreed it was unacceptable nothing was done.
reviews.title: a pleasant and relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from a two night stay with my partner and we were both disappointed. We had dinner in the hotel on the first night and we were expecting more for the price. I had the Tiger Prawn Salad and it contained 7 prawns, salad leaves and a dressing. This meal lacked substance and for what I got it was extremely overpriced. Don’t eat here and walk into the village, you’ll have a better meal. The original building was lovely but extension lacked character and looked odd. I personally think the room was no better than anything you would get at a Travelodge or any other Motorway hotel. The mattress on the bed was so soft we were lying on the bed frame and the shower was no better than a trickle and the taps dripped. The only reason it got a rating of 2 was because the staff were so friendly and the swimming pool was nice after a day out.
reviews.title: Just a posh Motorway Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I booked last minute as a guest I was going to a friends Wedding at near by Ettington Park . Not an easy place to find but was guided by 2 very helpfull front desk staff......Room very spacious and corprate but well laid out and decorated . All the staff very helpfull and the Full English was excellent I could not fault it . I did have 2 problems my iron was stuck with plastic melted on ....and the Hotel Guide was stuck together with something sticky ! The Duty manager replaced the iron very quickly with apologies ......but had Housekeeping looked at it it would not have been a problem . Also my shower in Room 115..... the Chrome was peeling off and some dodgy bits of sticky tape holding the panel on .....why dont the owners spent £20 to tidy it up ???? There was also a big stain outside the toilets down staries by the lounge !! It needs abit of TLC in places . Overall price / Sleep / Food (Breakfast only) / Staff was Excellent ......touch up the bits and get Housekeeping to check and your on a Winner !
reviews.title: A Great Stay : )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay booked with Travelzoo. This break was excellent value for money, the staff were all friendly and nothing was too much trouble, especially the young lad behind the bar who made everybody welcome (he will go far in the hotel industry !!)
reviews.title: Great for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast and evening meal in the restaurant, both were ok.
reviews.title: Rustic charm - I don't think so!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool and Jacuzzi were very relaxing and not to crowded.
reviews.title: Great for couples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 2 night special offer stay, what a lovelt stay it was too. I have been to many of the usual group hotels through work and you get very much the same sort of thing all round. The rooms are clean and provide all of the necessary, however our bed was a bit bouncy, we also heard others mentioning the beds but it was not bad enough to complain about. what set this place off, for us, was the service. The team there were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The evening meal was included and was really good, so much so we seriously considered eating there on our second night, however the closeness to Stratford upon Avon made too much of a draw. We would definately use the hotel again as long as price was in the same bracket, but at £72 per night per room, it was a steal.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We held our evening wedding reception at this hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone thinking of doing the same. The entire booking process was simple and efficent, Nicola the wedding co-ordinator is excellent and nothing is to much trouble for her. On the day I forgot to bring a wedding post box for all the cards, no problem they just made one out of a box and wrapping paper I provided !!
reviews.title: Great for Weddings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was amazing we choose the buffet food from a selection of sample menus and everyone raved about it, a month later I am still getting compliments on how good the food was !! 10 people didn't turn up on the night and a few arrived after the food but most of it still got eaten as people were going up several times as it was so nice.
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an executive room in the old part of the hotel which was nice with plenty of room, only complaint was the mattress was so soft, which I gather from other reviews is standard throughout the hotel. I know some people prefer a soft mattress but this one meant you had to lie on the very edge of the bed to prevent yourself rolling into the middle every time your partner moves, which still happened throughout the night. In the morning I had lower back ache which I haven't had for years.
reviews.title: Don't accept room 223!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good although not a huge selection considering it is a big hotel, not really a problem for us as we were only staying one night. I'm not sure why people feel the need to have a moan about the hotel being an old part and a new part, does it really matter ? The rooms are still the same just different lay outs. We didn't use the pool but our friend did and said it was nice.
reviews.title: not a bad hotel
